questions.question:

With reference to the HTML lines given above, consider the following statements.
1.Clicking on the point <80, 75> does not have any effect.
2.The web browser can identify the area applicable to the mouse-click within the image and the subsequent action to be taken without additional responses from the web server.
3.The dots in the cgi-bin URL will be resolved by the web browser before it is sent to the web server

questions.question:
Consider the following XML DTD describing course information in a university:

What is returned by the following XQuery?

 let $as := / /@Score
for $c in /Univ/Course[Eval]
let $cs := $c/Eval?@Score
where min($cs) > avg($as)
return $c


(GATE IT 2006)
options:
A.

The professor with the lowest course evaluation

B.

Professors who have all their course evaluations above the university average

D.

Courses with all evaluations above the university average
